intro: Xanthostemon eucalyptoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boxwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia. Xanthostemon eucalyptoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
